017package org.apache.commons.collections4.trie;
018
019import java.io.Serializable;
020import java.util.Comparator;
021
022/**
023 * Defines the interface to analyze {@link org.apache.commons.collections4.Trie Trie} keys on a bit level.
024 * {@link KeyAnalyzer}'s methods return the length of the key in bits, whether or not a bit is set,
025 * and bits per element in the key.
026 * <p>
027 * Additionally, a method determines if a key is a prefix of another
028 * key and returns the bit index where one key is different from another
029 * key (if the key and found key are equal than the return value is
030 * {@link #EQUAL_BIT_KEY}).
031 * </p>
032 *
033 * @param <K> the type of objects that may be compared by this analyzer
034 * @since 4.0
035 */
036public abstract class KeyAnalyzer<K> implements Comparator<K>, Serializable {
037
038    /** Serialization version */
039    private static final long serialVersionUID = -20497563720380683L;
040
041    /**
042     * Returned by {@link #bitIndex(Object, int, int, Object, int, int)}
043     * if key's bits are all 0.
044     */
045    public static final int NULL_BIT_KEY = -1;
046
047    /**
048     * Returned by {@link #bitIndex(Object, int, int, Object, int, int)} if key and found key are equal.
049     * This is a very, very specific case and shouldn't happen on a regular basis.
050     */
051    public static final int EQUAL_BIT_KEY = -2;
052
053    public static final int OUT_OF_BOUNDS_BIT_KEY = -3;
054
055    /**
056     * Returns true if bitIndex is a {@link KeyAnalyzer#EQUAL_BIT_KEY}.
057     */
058    static boolean isEqualBitKey(final int bitIndex) {
059        return bitIndex == EQUAL_BIT_KEY;
060    }
061
062    /**
063     * Returns true if bitIndex is a {@link KeyAnalyzer#NULL_BIT_KEY}.
064     */
065    static boolean isNullBitKey(final int bitIndex) {
066        return bitIndex == NULL_BIT_KEY;
067    }
068
069    /**
070     * Returns true if bitIndex is a {@link KeyAnalyzer#OUT_OF_BOUNDS_BIT_KEY}.
071     */
072    static boolean isOutOfBoundsIndex(final int bitIndex) {
073        return bitIndex == OUT_OF_BOUNDS_BIT_KEY;
074    }
075
076    /**
077     * Returns true if the given bitIndex is valid.
078     * Indices are considered valid if they're between 0 and {@link Integer#MAX_VALUE}
079     */
080    static boolean isValidBitIndex(final int bitIndex) {
081        return bitIndex >= 0;
082    }
083
084    /**
085     * Returns the n-th different bit between key and other. This starts the comparison in
086     * key at 'offsetInBits' and goes for 'lengthInBits' bits, and compares to the other key starting
087     * at 'otherOffsetInBits' and going for 'otherLengthInBits' bits.
088     *
089     * @param key  the key to use
090     * @param offsetInBits  the bit offset in the key
091     * @param lengthInBits  the maximum key length in bits to use
092     * @param other  the other key to use
093     * @param otherOffsetInBits  the bit offset in the other key
094     * @param otherLengthInBits  the maximum key length in bits for the other key
095     * @return the bit index where the key and other first differ
096     */
097    public abstract int bitIndex(K key, int offsetInBits, int lengthInBits,
098                                 K other, int otherOffsetInBits, int otherLengthInBits);
099
100    /**
101     * Returns the number of bits per element in the key.
102     * This is only useful for variable-length keys, such as Strings.
103     *
104     * @return the number of bits per element
105     */
106    public abstract int bitsPerElement();
107
108    @Override
109    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
110    public int compare(final K o1, final K o2) {
111        if (o1 == null) {
112            return o2 == null ? 0 : -1;
113        }
114        if (o2 == null) {
115            return 1;
116        }
117
118        return ((Comparable<K>) o1).compareTo(o2);
119    }
120
121    /**
122     * Returns whether or not a bit is set.
123     *
124     * @param key  the key to check, may not be null
125     * @param bitIndex  the bit index to check
126     * @param lengthInBits  the maximum key length in bits to check
127     * @return {@code true} if the bit is set in the given key and
128     *   {@code bitIndex} &lt; {@code lengthInBits}, {@code false} otherwise.
129     */
130    public abstract boolean isBitSet(K key, int bitIndex, int lengthInBits);
131
132    /**
133     * Determines whether or not the given prefix (from offset to length) is a prefix of the given key.
134     *
135     * @param prefix  the prefix to check
136     * @param offsetInBits  the bit offset in the key
137     * @param lengthInBits  the maximum key length in bits to use
138     * @param key  the key to check
139     * @return {@code true} if this is a valid prefix for the given key
140     */
141    public abstract boolean isPrefix(K prefix, int offsetInBits, int lengthInBits, K key);
142
143    /**
144     * Returns the length of the Key in bits.
145     *
146     * @param key  the key
147     * @return the bit length of the key
148     */
149    public abstract int lengthInBits(K key);
150
151}
